newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan buys Apr/May low sulphur fuel at $115-135/T.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan buys Apr/May low sulphur fuel at $115-135/T.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has bought more than two 38,000-tonne cargoes of low sulphur low pour fuel oil for April and May delivery, a company official said on Thursday.
CPC bought one cargo of 1.0-percent low sulphur fuel oil at $115-$116 per tonne for delivery around May 10-20.
It also bought more than one cargo of 0.5-percent low sulphur fuel oil at $130-$135 per tonne for delivery April 16-30, the official said.
The cargoes are bought on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Keelung, Taichung, Kaohsiung or Shenao.
In its last tender, CPC bought more than one cargo of 38,000-tonne 0.5 percent low sulphur fuel oil at $136-$139 per tonne.
